This is one of the best experience I had from a video game. I was playing through the entire Valve catalogue and enjoyed Half-Life 1, while I admit that it is obtuse at times and unfair at others. Half-Life 2 deserves to be played by everyone, even if they haven't played the first games. 

The difference between the previous games and to the Source Engine is unreal. The graphics and the physics are infinitely better. This game is fun, it has actual good autosaves (removing the need to constantly save and reload), and is really fun.

DOOM será el padre de los shooters, pero esta saga es el rey. La primera entrega ya sorprendió en su día con el apartado gráfico y la inclusión del plataformeo y la narrativa, su secuela repitió en 2004 rompiendo esquemas una vez mas, un imprescindible del género y los videojuegos en general.

Покупайте или же скачивайте через торренты и проходите этот шедевр, игра оптимизирована поэтому не потянуть она просто не может и проходите эту великую классику, а если она вам понравится, то пройдите эпизоды, а если вы счастливчик, у которого есть ВР,проходите alyx. As much as they are hated on I do not agree with the excessive hate on the New Super Mario Bros. series while personally I think the first game isn't that great and the second isn't all too original I still believe they are good games. New Super Mario Bros. Wii on the other hand I think is a great game with lots of unique concepts, while not being anything super different from its predecessor it is overall a better experience with more unique levels that the game doesn't lock behind secret exits in castles and a greater use for star coins in the ninth world of the game, which despite the tediousness of entry to the levels they provide a good challenge. New Super Mario Bros U and New Super Luigi U are just a better version of the Wii game seeming very similar on the surface but with a better world map and level design. New Super Luigi U Has a great challenge due to the new physics which makes the game fun and satisfying to complete. Overall I think they get too much hate for how much better they are even compared to the older NES and SNES games.

The Industrial Revolution and its consequences have been a disaster for the human race. They have greatly increased the life-expectancy of those of us who live in “advanced” countries, but they have destabilized society, have made life unfulfilling, have subjected human beings to indignities, have led to widespread psychological suffering (in the Third World to physical suffering as well) and have inflicted severe damage on the natural world. The continued development of technology will worsen the situation. It will certainly subject human beings to greater indignities and inflict greater damage on the natural world, it will probably lead to greater social disruption and psychological suffering, and it may lead to increased physical suffering even in “advanced” countries.

Valve does it again. Another masterpiece!

Obvious that Valve improved upon creating Half-Life. The path is always clear, the game yells at you where to go, but you don't notice, which makes it very enjoyable. The usage of Source's physics engine in different puzzles and other places is always very fun (except when they get janky (love you source)). The narrative of the whole story makes you feel like you really take part of it!

Another game added to my list of favorites!
Otimo, Steam.
